alert.note: Alert for Bradley; East Polk; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 9:44PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bradley and Polk Counties through 1130 PM EST... At 1044 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Charleston to near Wildwood Lake to Cohutta. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Benton, Ducktown, Wildwood Lake, South Cleveland, William L. Davenport Refuge, Waterville, Conasauga, Big Frog Mountain, Parksville and Turtletown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.
